alert.note: Alert for Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 2:04PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW A WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...All areas of northeast Siskiyou and Modoc Counties. This includes Alturas Tulelake, Dorris, Macdoel, Day, Lookout, Canby, and Likely. This also includes Highways 139, 299, and 395. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers will taper off this afternoon. After a relative break in weather, another system will arrive Friday evening which could bring additional moderate to heavy snow. More details to come. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
